criteria: Application of Multiplication to Solve Word Problems
Use of Visual Fraction Models and Equations
descriptions: No understanding of fraction multiplication is demonstrated.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of fraction multiplication concepts; struggles to apply the concept to simple problems.
Shows partial understanding of fraction multiplication; can solve simple problems with guidance but struggles with more complex scenarios.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of fraction multiplication; can solve most problems independently but may need some assistance with complex word problems.
Exhibits a strong understanding of fraction multiplication; can solve complex problems independently and accurately, including those with visual models.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of fraction multiplication; can solve complex problems with visual models and explain the underlying mathematical principles effectively.
Unable to apply multiplication to solve any part of the word problem.
Struggles significantly to apply multiplication; unable to extract relevant information or set up the problem.
Can partially apply multiplication but struggles with the setup; may make errors in calculation or interpretation of the problem.
Generally able to apply multiplication to solve word problems; can set up the problem correctly and arrive at a reasonable answer, but may have minor calculation errors.
Effectively applies multiplication to solve word problems accurately; demonstrates a clear understanding of the context and correctly interprets the solution.
Masterfully applies multiplication to solve complex word problems; provides clear and accurate solutions, including interpretation and verification of the answer within the context of the problem.
Does not attempt to use visual fraction models or equations.
Attempts to use visual models or equations but is unable to create an accurate representation or solve the problem.
Can create a partially accurate visual model or equation but struggles with using it to find the correct solution.
Uses visual fraction models and equations effectively to solve problems; the representation is accurate, but the explanation might lack clarity.
Uses visual fraction models and equations proficiently to solve problems; can clearly explain the model or equation and how it relates to the solution.

Expertly uses visual fraction models and equations to solve complex problems; provides a detailed and insightful explanation of the model or equation and its connection to the solution, demonstrating a deep understanding of the concepts.
Unable to determine the whole number range the answer lies between.
Struggles to determine the whole number range and provides an incorrect or nonsensical answer.
Attempts to determine the whole number range but makes significant errors or requires considerable guidance.
Generally able to determine the whole number range but may need minor assistance or clarification.
Accurately determines the whole number range and provides a clear explanation of the reasoning.
Insightfully determines the whole number range and provides a comprehensive and logical explanation, demonstrating a strong understanding of number sense.
